CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 19, 1955, pg. 4, reads: "Clairton Slayer Sentenced - James Frazier, 30, of Clairton, leaves the courtroom of Judge Russell H. Adams, after receiving a ten-to-twenty-year penitentiary sentence for the Oct. 26 slaying of a 51-year-old man. Frazier, using a a shotgun, snuffed out the life of Harry Pulliam, of 343 State Street, who accused Frazier of going with the woman who was holding the birthday party. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Women and men, including police officer wearing badge on lapel, escorting James Frazier on left, after receiving murder sentence, through the corridor of the Allegheny County Courthouse
